title.narrative: Civic Participation - Citizen Participation and Oversight

description.narrative: Strengthen the legal, regulatory, institutional, and information environment which protects and enables the growth in associational life and the development of independent and sustainable civil society organizations (CSOs). Build the capacity of civil society organizations to act as agents for reform and support their participation in democratic decision-making through articulating and representing their members interests, engaging in service delivery, and advocating for issues which become part of the public agenda and are reflected in public policies. Encourage the strengthening of a civic culture which supports democratic institutions and processes, active participation in political and civic life, and the civic virtues of tolerance, pluralism, compromise, trust, and respect for individual rights, including gender equality.

description.narrative: Improve the capacity of businesses to integrate into domestic and international markets through increases in productivity and improvements in corporate governance and the development and application of modern technology and marketing practices. Enhance the capacity of businesses and business associations in terms of their corporate governance capabilities and their application of best practices and technologies to achieve increased production and marketing of products and services. It includes adoption of efficient production processes, improved labor productivity, environmentally-sound management of natural resources and the development of accounting and management systems that can help the company and industry group implement business, labor, product and process standards that enhance business competitiveness. Business capacity development programs may include activities that help men- and women-owned firms and associations respond to these international markets and create regional alliances.

description.narrative: Improve the capacity and sustainability of civil and criminal justice sector actors and institutions, enhance coordination amongst them, develop citizen demand for an effective and accountable justice system, and develop associations to advocate for all citizens. Justice sector actors and institutions include: police, border security, prosecutors, forensics experts, judges, court personnel, public defenders, corrections personnel, private bar, law schools, legal professional associations, and training institutions for each of them. Work towards an equitable justice system by ensuring equality before the law, fair trial standards, and other elements of procedural fairness. Ensure more equitable access to justice through innovations within and beyond the state system and through improvements in the quality and quantity of justice services, with a particular focus on women, youth, the poor, and other marginalized or vulnerable groups. Programs primarily focused on trafficking in persons or migrant smuggling should be included in element 5.3 under the Transnational Crime area in the Peace and Security Objective.

description.narrative: (Kyrgyz Republic): .The USAID Enterprise Competitiveness Project (ECP) will strengthen micro-, small-, and medium-sized enterprises (MSMEs) to increase incomes and jobs in some of the poorest regions of the Kyrgyz Republic. By increasing the capacity of businesses, linking companies to markets, and improving access to finance, the activity will generate new jobs and increase income for Kyrgyzstanis...The project will support MSMEs, especially those led by women and youth, in basic management and business skills to help SMEs operate more commercially and produce competitively-priced, higher quality goods and services. These improvements enable MSMEs to link to more formal, functioning market systems at the national level. MSMEs create commercial micro-economies and generate sustainable livelihoods for rural households...The project will also work with banks and investment organizations such as local private equity funds to mobilize private capital, including growth-oriented capital, to sustainably finance businesses. By encouraging business growth and entrepreneurship in underdeveloped parts of the Kyrgyz Republic, the activity will help reactivate the post-pandemic economy, reducing poverty and unemployment. ..The activity will work with government and business associations to address market policy constraints to the growth of SMEs, increases in sales, and the creation of job opportunities for Kyrgyzstani households. This activity supports ICS objectives 2.1: Expansion of diversified and equitable economy bolsters economic growth and increases market opportunities for U.S. businesses and academic institutions, supporting investment and prosperity, and 3.2: Support improved policy formation, governance, and service delivery to better connect the government to its people..

description.narrative: Evaluation is the systematic collection and analysis of information about the characteristics and outcomes of programs and projects as a basis for judgments, to improve effectiveness and inform decisions about current and future programming. Evaluations are distinct from (a) needs assessments, which are designed to examine country or sector context to inform project design, (b) internal informal reviews of projects and (c) audits (conducted either internally or by an external audience). Such efforts should not be included in PO.3. However, evaluability assessments -- those assessments completed with the purpose of determining whether or not an evaluation of an activity can be conducted -- should be included in PO.3. This program area should include all evaluations designed and funded with foreign assistance funding, including the components of contracts with task orders for evaluations (regardless of the mechanism). It should also include all independent contractors hired solely to produce an evaluation(s); all other contractors (e.g., those whose job responsibilities may include support or management of evaluation but not the production of an evaluation as a deliverable) should be placed in PO.2

title.narrative: Increasing Public Trust in the Judiciary, IPTJ

description.narrative: (Kyrgyz Republic): International Development Law Organization (IDLO) under the time and cost extension will address the overarching problem of corruption in the judiciary facilitating increase of public trust in the judiciary. More specifically, IDLO will offer technical support for expanded access to and use of audio-video transcripts (AVT) during trials to prevent corrupt practices; will increase awareness, understanding, and appreciation of the value added of audio video transcripts; improve independent capacity to support and maintain AVT systems across the Judiciary; strengthen integration of AVT with e-justice initiatives across the justice sector thus enabling of the capacities necessary to integrate AVT usage within the broader context of e-justice initiatives being developed within the Kyrgyz Judiciary. A critical number of judges, court personnel, and other legal professionals will be identified and prepared to create training modules and provide training concerning uses of AVT in the context of e-justice advancements being currently introduced (on-line filings, publication of judicial decisions, e-evidence, electronic signatures, etc.) to other legal/judicial system professionals (and future professionals) at existing professional training centers and universities.

description.narrative: (Kyrgyz Republic): .This project will improve participation of underserved children in the Kyrgyz Republic in target primary schools, and support the Ministry of Education and Science (MOES) in expanding these gains nationwide. The project will:.Ensure accessibility of improved reading instruction for children with special education needs, including children with disabilities;Introduce multilingual education in schools of ethnic minorities, particularly in Tajik and Uzbek schools;Support the capacity at school, district, and national level to assess reading outcomes of all children in early grades to inform the best teaching practice, especially of poorly performing children..UNICEF in Kyrgyzstan possesses unique technical expertise and relationships, which make them best positioned to implement this activity. UNICEF piloted and evaluated multilingual education in the country, was the driving force behind the development of the nascent inclusive education program for children with disabilities, and continues to provide direct technical assistance to the Government of the Kyrgyz Republic's MOES in these areas. Due to its past successes in the politically sensitive area of minority language education, UNICEF is unique among implementing organizations in holding the confidence and government permission necessary to implement this activity. ..By building on the gains of USAID's projects on improved reading (Reading Together and Time to Read) that have reached all public schools with Kyrgyz and Russian languages of instruction, the project will support system changes to ensure sustainability of the interventions promoting inclusive education and effective learning for the most vulnerable children. By improving access to higher quality education for ethnic minorities and children with disabilities, this activity supports IC

title.narrative: USAID Improved Basic Education in the Kyrgyz Republic, Okuu Keremet!

description.narrative: (Kyrgyz Republic): .USAID invests in the economic and political future of the Kyrgyz Republic by improving education for its youngest citizens. Planned support will give children a better foundation for educational achievement by improving instructional quality in both math and reading through improved curricula and stronger teacher training, mentorship, and support systems. To improve the learning environment, the activity will increase community support for learning, conduct out-of-school learning activities, and increase the availability of learning materials through development, production, and distribution. Lastly, programming will improve the capacity of the Ministry of Education and Sciences, by providing technical support to optimize the education system for greater efficiencies, improve pre-service training for teachers and education leaders, and increase access to quality education for all students, especially vulnerable populations...This activity supports the ICS Mission Objective 3.2: Government institutions that can effectively formulate and implement policies and provide quality services in an equitable and transparent, accountable way. Okuu Keremet(!) contributes $3,645,0002 towards Operating Unit Basic Education directive through this mechanism; $200,000 are contributed from Administration and Oversight and $20,000 from Program Design and Learning... ...

description.narrative: (Kyrgyz Republic): Cure Tuberculosis (TB) reduces the burden of drug-resistant TB (DR-TB) in the Kyrgyz Republic. To achieve this, the activity will increase DR-TB case detection in primary health care and community-based settings; improve laboratory services and networks; increase the treatment success rate by ensuring that patients are treated with the appropriate drug regimens and by providing case management support for patients to complete their treatment; prevent DR-TB infections through improved infection control in health facilities and laboratories; change provider, patient, and at-risk populations behaviors for improved TB prevention, detection, and treatment; and improve the enabling environment for sustainable TB services through improved financing for TB services, improved data for decision making, updated policies, and reduced stigma and discrimination. The activity will achieve these goals through a combination of technical assistance, mentoring, policy formation, and advocacy. The combination of these efforts will build on the previous programming and address constraints in reducing the transmission of DR-TB within the Kyrgyz Republic...This activity also supports ICS objective 3.2: Government institutions that can effectively formulate and implement policies and provide quality services in an equitable, transparent, and accountable way..This IM contributes $4,070,000 toward the $6,000,000 FY 2022 Operating Unit TB directive. .. .

title.narrative: Active Communities in the Kyrgyz Republic, Jigerduu Jarandar

description.narrative: (Kyrgyz Republic): USAID's Active Communities activity will continue to support the achievement of national priorities with regards to local development by strengthening citizen participation in democratic governance. It will also help local governments, communities, civil society organizations, and the private sector to better work together for achieving common goals. The activity will work with 20 municipalities across the country in the following thematic areas: 1) Support municipal waste management solutions, 2) Defend and expand civic space and participation through broadening and deepening networks of civic leaders and associations to expand and strengthen advocacy, with a focus on legislative reforms, 3) Improve access to justice, 4) Reduce gender-based violence by supporting Local Committees for the Prevention of Domestic Violence and women's crisis centers. In Year 4 grants will be provided to civil society to implement innovative solutions across these four thematic areas. This activity supports ICS objective 3.2: Government institutions that can effectively formulate and implement policies, and provide quality services in an equitable, transparent, and accountable way, and 3.3: An inclusive democracy featuring promotion of human rights and vibrant, effective civic engagements. USAID's contribution to meeting the 12,000,000 DRG directive through this IM is $3,342,800. The FY 2022 Operating Unit TIP directive is $1,000,000. USAID's contribution to meeting the TIP directive through this IM is $160,000.

title.narrative: Local Response to TB in the Kyrgyz Republic, TB LON

description.narrative: (Kyrgyz Republic): To accelerate the elimination of TB in the Kyrgyz Republic, USAID partners with local non-government organizations to enable local solutions and sustainability of the TB response. The TB Local Organizations Network (LON) activity supports prevention, care, and treatment of TB through a direct agreement with local organizations, which is a key component of the USAID TB Portfolio's localization efforts. TB LON partners exclusively with local organizations and implements locally-generated solutions to improve TB services. In close collaboration with the Cure TB activity, the TB LON activity contributes to reducing the burden of DR-TB in the Kyrgyz Republic. To achieve this, the activity will continue to increase active TB case detection among contacts of TB patients through community-based detection; contribute to the increase of the treatment success rate among TB defaulters through case management; improve the enabling environment for reduced stigma and discrimination of the TB patients through raising awareness among the general population; and ensure advocacy for strengthening the country's national dialogue for TB services, improved data for decision making, updated policies, and reduced stigma and discrimination...This activity also supports ICS Mission Objective 3.2: Government Institutions that can effectively formulate and implement policies and provide quality services in an equitable, transparent, and accountable way. It also supports CDCS DO 2: Robust and Diversified Economic Opportunities for the People of the Kyrgyz Republic, IR 2.2: Improved equitable access to quality health services. Specifically, this activity will contribute to sub-IR 2.2.3: Case detection and treatment adherence to control infection disease threats, especially HIV and TB, improved...This IM contributes $935,000 toward the $6,000,000 FY 2022 Operating Unit TB directive. .. .

description.narrative: (Kyrgyz Republic): .USAID's Agro Trade activity will apply a market-oriented approach to support companies and workers in two to three agricultural products (i.e. value chains) to increase Kyrgyzstani jobs through increased cross-boundary trade in Ferghana Valley. The activity will help Kyrgyzstani businesses increase trade by linking them to other firms across borders, building foundations for long-lasting regional economic ties...The activity will improve conditions for trade and investments in the southern Kyrgyz Republic and eliminate obstacles to cross-border trade in the Ferghana Valley. Illustrative activities include support to the Ministry of Economy to examine and eliminate obstacles at borders, particularly between Uzbekistan and The Kyrgyz Republic, and support that helps farmers and processors comply with international and regional phytosanitary standards. For example, the activity may conduct informational activities or support the Government of the Kyrgyz Republic (GOKR) with laboratory equipment to conduct phytosanitary inspections. Agro Trade funding contributes $1,100,000 toward the $2.3M microenterprise earmark. ..This activity supports ICS objective Mission Objective 2.1: An accessible, diversified, ideas-based economy attracting greater international and regional interconnectivity... .. .. .

description.narrative: Evaluation is the systematic collection and analysis of information about the characteristics and outcomes of programs and projects as a basis for judgments, to improve effectiveness and inform decisions about current and future programming. Evaluations are distinct from (a) needs assessments, which are designed to examine country or sector context to inform project design, (b) internal informal reviews of projects and (c) audits (conducted either internally or by an external audience). Such efforts should not be included in PO.3. However, evaluability assessments -- those assessments completed with the purpose of determining whether or not an evaluation of an activity can be conducted -- should be included in PO.3. This program area should include all evaluations designed and funded with foreign assistance funding, including the components of contracts with task orders for evaluations (regardless of the mechanism). It should also include all independent contractors hired solely to produce an evaluation(s); all other contractors (e.g., those whose job responsibilities may include support or management of evaluation but not the production of an evaluation as a deliverable) should be placed in PO.2

title.narrative: Nonpartisan Domestic Observation of Parliamentary Elections

description.narrative: (Kyrgyz Republic): USAID has supported nonpartisan domestic election monitoring and voter education in the Kyrgyz Republic for almost two decades, which has led to increasingly proficient electoral processes and consistent democratic gains. In light of resurgent authoritarianism and increasing pressure on the Kyrgyz Republic from non-democratic states, it is critical to continue supporting election monitoring to ensure the Kyrgyz Republic remains a model of democratic progress in Central Asian that reformers in the region can emulate. USAID's new Domestic Observation of Parliamentary Elections Activity will build on this longstanding support with an approach rooted in short- and long-term domestic observation during the 2020 parliamentary elections. The overall purpose of the activity is to inform voters and the general public about the election process and promote the roles and responsibilities of the voter. This activity will have three components: voter education, long- and short-term observation, and electoral administration and legislation monitoring, which together will support the overall goal of increasing citizen involvement in and responsibility for the governance process. This activity supports ICS objective 3.1, "Support a more inclusive and accountable democracy."

title.narrative: USAID Rule of Law/Anti-Corruption Activity in the Kyrgyz Republic, Ukuk Bulagy

description.narrative: (Kyrgyz Republic): USAID's Rule-of-Law and Anti-Corruption Activity, known as "Ukuk Bulagy," will continue to strengthen the transparency and accountability of the judiciary and other key government institutions by supporting the following four objectives: 1) Strengthen the judiciary as a core pillar of the governance and rule of law architecture; 2) Strengthen justice and legal services to address legal problems, resolve disputes, and protect fundamental rights and thus close the justice gap; 3) Strengthen the connection between the judiciary and society by ensuring that the systems and services are more responsive to the population as a whole and equipped to address the legal problems and justice needs of the communities and businesses they are mandated to service; and, 4) Engage select executive institutions and parliament to strengthen open government policies and the delivery of services across sectors in a more transparent, accountable, and citizen-responsive manner. In addition, by improving service delivery and reducing everyday corruption, the activity strengthens Kyrgyz democratic institutions and contributes to rebuilding the Kyrgyz Republic's constituency for democracy. This activity will support ICS objective 3.1: A culture of respect for rule of law with reduced corruption. USAID's contribution to meeting the $12,000,000 DRG directive through this IM is $1,915,000. The FY 2022 Operating Unit TIP directive is $1,000,000. USAID's contribution to meeting the TIP directive through this IM is $80,000.

description.narrative: (Kyrgyz Republic): USAID's Successful Aimak 2 Activity will continue to promote more effective and inclusive political systems and governing institutions at the local level to strengthen the Kyrgyz Republic's constituency for democracy. In particular, the activity will focus on: 1) effective service delivery by assisting local governments in improving their ability to effectively manage and finance the delivery of key services, such as solid waste removal and clean water, by using local solutions and public-private partnerships; 2) citizen participation by engaging all citizen groups including women, youth and minorities in the decision making process at the local level. Citizens will also provide feedback on services and advocate for more transparent and accountable governance systems while also seeking avenues for citizen and community organization collaboration with local governments; and 3) local ownership by strengthening the capacity of local stakeholders, such as the Union of Local Self-Governments, to increasingly lead in identifying and addressing development challenges. Fifty municipalities in four provinces will receive technical support to implement more effective services to their communities. This technical support may include training on procurement, legal advice, and increased skill development in budgeting and management. This activity will support ICS objective 3.2: Government institutions that can effectively formulate and implement policies, and provide quality services in an equitable, transparent, and accountable way. USAID's contribution to meeting the $12,000,000 DRG directive through this IM is $ 1,200,000.

description.narrative: All facility-based and home/community-based activities for HIV-infected adults and their families aimed at extending and optimizing quality of life for HIV-infected clients and their families throughout the continuum of illness through provision of clinical, psychological, spiritual, social and prevention services. Clinical care should include prevention and treatment of OIs (excluding TB) and other HIV/AIDS-related complications including malaria and diarrhea (providing access to commodities such as pharmaceuticals, insecticide-treated nets, safe water interventions and related laboratory services), pain and symptom relief, and nutritional assessment and support including food. Psychological and spiritual support may include group and individual counseling and culturally-appropriate end-of-life care and bereavement services. Social support may include vocational training, income-generating activities, social and legal protection, and training and support of caregivers. Prevention services may include prevention for positives behavioral counseling, and counseling and testing of family members. The purchase of OI drugs (excluding TB drugs) should be included under Adult Care and Treatment. ARV treatment should be coded under Adult Treatment and ARV Drugs.

description.narrative: This program area covers components of program design and performance management and learning. This area supports assessment, special studies and analysis, strategic planning, program and project design, program monitoring (to include baseline studies and other data collection needs) and activities that support learning, knowledge transfer and adaptation of projects. Assessment includes the examination of the state of a country or sector context to inform project design but does not include evaluation of USG-funded activities (please see Program Area PO.3 for a definition of evaluation). Special studies or analysis could support strategic or project planning or include research for general learning that is not necessarily related to the performance of USG-funded activities. This program area may also include the preparation of strategic plans and other short-term programming tasks, assessment of the potential of information and communication technologies to enhance performance throughout the program cycle or dissemination of best practices and lessons learned.

title.narrative: Sustainable Trans-boundary Resource Allocation Mechanisms for Peace in the Fergana Valley (stream)

description.narrative: the programme has the following overall objective (oo) and specific objectives (so):..to contribute to improving the sustainable use of natural water and land resources across all riparian communities (oo1).water efficiency at the local level is improved and competition over resources reduced (so1).dialogue and cooperation between local authorities and experts at the regional level will be enhanced through mutual trust and transboundary information, platforms and dispute resolution processes (so2)..in addition, the anticipated results (r) are as follows:..an in-depth understanding of root causes (including climate stress) is developed and used to restart regional dialogue (r1).stakeholders are empowered to make nrm more conflict sensitive at the community level, while also reducing pressure on natural resources, feeding into increased regional dialogue (r2).transboundary dialogue and cooperation at the community and government level is strengthened by further improving data collection, operating infrastructure and raising awareness (r3)

title.narrative: Kyrgyz Republic Trusted and Accountable Politics

description.narrative: (Kyrgyz Republic): USAID's Kyrgyz Republic Trusted and Accountable Politics Activity will continue to advance Kyrgyz democracy by strengthening trust and accountability between citizens, elected officials, and the State. It will do so by supporting the following three objectives: 1) Strengthen Kyrgyz culture of constructive engagement in political processes; 2) Promote free, fair, and competitive electoral processes that are trusted by Kyrgyzstanis; and, 3) Strengthen legislative officials' responsiveness and accountability to citizen demands and their capacity to generate citizen-centered legislation, Expected activities will include strengthening of political parties, assisting the central election commission to improve the organization of elections supporting organizational development of domestic election monitoring organizations, including intensive capacity building and technical support in conducting short- and long-term election observation; and supporting leadership opportunities and civic education to increase inclusion of historically underserved and disenfranchised groups, including youth and women and people with disabilities. This activity advances ICS objective 3.3: An inclusive democracy featuring promotion of human rights and vibrant, effective civic engagement. USAID's contribution to meeting the $12,000,000 DRG directive through this IM is $1,800,000.

description.narrative: (Kyrgyz Republic): USAID's Media Activity will continue to strengthen Kyrgyz citizens' awareness, engagement and participation in the social, economic and political processes by increasing the viability, professionalism and vibrancy of local, factual, and diverse independent media in the Kyrgyz Republic. It will partner with local media outlets and organizations to achieve this goal through four interdependent objectives: 1) increase entrepreneurial and innovative content offerings through training and content grants; 2) Localize media development efforts and, grow local technical expertise for media practitioners through training, mentorship, and organizational development; 3) improve local market conditions for local media and local media management practice by expanding market information and business consulting for local outlets; and, 4) strengthen local resilience to disinformation by supporting existing Kyrgyz efforts to counter disinformation and increase media literacy. The activity will emphasize support for media outlets outside of Bishkek, developing these small media enterprises, and increasing production of more engaging and data driven local content in the Kyrgyz language. This activity will support ICS objective 3.3: An inclusive democracy featuring promotion of human rights and vibrant, effective civic engagement. USAID's contributions to meeting the $12,000,000 DRG and $2,300,000 Microenterprise directives through this IM are $1,500,000 and $300,000 respectively.

description.narrative: Evaluation is the systematic collection and analysis of information about the characteristics and outcomes of programs and projects as a basis for judgments, to improve effectiveness and inform decisions about current and future programming. Evaluations are distinct from (a) needs assessments, which are designed to examine country or sector context to inform project design, (b) internal informal reviews of projects and (c) audits (conducted either internally or by an external audience). Such efforts should not be included in PO.3. However, evaluability assessments -- those assessments completed with the purpose of determining whether or not an evaluation of an activity can be conducted -- should be included in PO.3. This program area should include all evaluations designed and funded with foreign assistance funding, including the components of contracts with task orders for evaluations (regardless of the mechanism). It should also include all independent contractors hired solely to produce an evaluation(s); all other contractors (e.g., those whose job responsibilities may include support or management of evaluation but not the production of an evaluation as a deliverable) should be placed in PO.2

description.narrative: Improve the capacity of businesses, including the self-employed poor; micro, small and medium enterprises (MSMEs); and high growth potential entrepreneurs, to start or grow and integrate into domestic and international markets through increases in productivity and improvements in corporate governance and the development and application of modern technology and marketing practices. Enhance the capacity of businesses and business associations in terms of their corporate governance capabilities and their application of best practices and technologies to achieve increased production and marketing of products and services. It includes adoption of efficient production processes, improved labor productivity, environmentally-sound management of natural resources and the development of accounting and management systems that can help the company and industry group implement business, labor, product and process standards that enhance business competitiveness. Business capacity development programs may include activities that help men- and women-owned firms and associations respond to these international markets and create regional alliances.

description.narrative: Strengthen the organizational capacity of Civil Society Organizations (CSOs) for policy analysis and oversight, advocacy, coalition-building, internal governance, membership representation and services, and providing sustainable services that consistently meet the needs, priorities, and expectations of their constituents and communities. description.narrative: The Youth Theater for Peace program promotes sustainable conflict prevention at the community level through a participatory theater methodology called Drama for Conflict Transformation (DCT). IREXs programs introduce DCT to teachers, youth-serving professionals and teenagers (15-16) in rural, conflict-prone areas of Kyrgyzstan (2010 2014) and Tajikistan (2010 2012). By strengthening youth-serving institutions and equipping youth with the attitudes and skills to become agents of peace, the program creates a group of empowered youth and supportive adults ready to lead community-based conflict resolution activities. Participants share DCT techniques to create dialogue and promote tolerance within their larger communities.

Objectives for Kyrgyzstan: The Youth Theater for Peace (YTP) program promotes sustainable conflict prevention and a culture of peace at the community, regional, and national levels through a participatory theater methodology called Drama for Conflict Transformation (DCT). The YTP model equips youth and their adult mentors to lead community-based conflict resolution activities and build trust across ethnic and religious lines. Through DCT theater training, youth and adult participants develop skills to analyze, prevent, and resolve conflict; facilitate and lead conflict resolution activities; and engage audiences in their home communities.

title.narrative: Kyrgyz Agro-Input Enterprise Development Project (KAED) Follow-on

description.narrative: The USAID KAED Follow-On project extends the impact of KAED on improving food security and rural incomes. The project is enhancing food security through expanded adoption of improved production technologies, value chain linkages and public-private partnerships (PPPs). KAED Follow-On has helped diffuse livestock sector capital investment under the Economic Development Fund III (EDF III). Technology transfer is a key strategic intervention area, with an emphasis on the introduction of improved seed and fertilizers, minimum tillage technology, composting and modern agricultural machinery to improve productivity and contribute to an increase in the competitiveness of Kyrgyz agriculture.

description.narrative: (Kyrgyz Republic): .The Judicial Strengthening Program aims to increase the independence, effectiveness, and integrity of the judicial system through a more fair and open system of trials and court processes. The program focuses on the human and institutional capacity of the Kyrgyz Republic's judiciary by developing skills and improving processes. The program plans to increase the transparency of key judicial systems and reduce corruption within the courts. Four anticipated results include: (1) the Judicial Council will be better able to advocate for sufficient budget allocation based on its approved strategic plan; (2) the Judicial Training Center will be better equipped to host quality training courses; (3) a courtroom security strategy will be developed in partnership with all judicial sector actors; and (4) a court information system program will be expanded to a larger number of court. FY 2016 funding will continue to support the comprehensive retraining of 75 percent of the country's judicial cadre....

title.narrative: Support to the Kyrgyzstani Legal Defense Community

description.narrative: (Kyrgyz Republic): This activity will support the professionalization of the country's newly-established independent defense bar in order to improve access to justice in the Kyrgyz Republic. Interventions will focus on strengthening the defense bar's internal regulations, professional development for the defense advocate community, and building public support for the bar. Expected results include a more professional, capable, and independent cadre of defense attorneys, increased access to justice, and sound legal representation for citizens of the Kyrgyz Republic.

title.narrative: Conflict Mitigation through Targeted Analysis and Community Action in Kyrgyzstan

description.narrative: Conflict Mitigation through Targeted Analysis and Community Action in Kyrgyzstan

Objectives for Kyrgyzstan: The goal of the program is to minimize the risk of instability through informed public policy and early warning analysis for citizen protection. This is accomplished by: Supporting actionable analysis on conflict and instability trends. Supporting informal and formal community leadership for conflict mitigation through the creation of Early Warning Networks to analyze and resolve potential conflicts, mediate disputes, and contribute to peace building activities. Developing the REACH Initiative Conflict Early Warning web-based mapping tool as an early warning system for identifying vectors of potential conflict and disputes. Improving the capacity of national institutions such as the Presidential Administration, ministries, and the Parliament, as well as that of local leaders, to identify key concerns and enhance policy-making with data and analysis on conflict trends.

title.narrative: Ak Zhol: The Path to Peace through Prosperity

description.narrative: Ak Zhol: The Path to Peace through Prosperity

Objectives for Kyrgyzstan: Ak-Zhol is a conflict mitigation project that works to decrease tensions between these displaced groups and vulnerable local communities in seven areas in the southern Kyrgyzstan. Small grants and micro-credit loans to small business groups, provided by the project, reinforce stable economic conditions within local communities and function as a venue for cooperation, communication, and mutual benefit. The project also provides training on organizational sustainability, business planning and implementation, and establishing community development funds to finance social projects identified by communities.

description.narrative: (Kyrgyz Republic): .USAID will continue to reinforce the stability of the Kyrgyz Republic by fostering partnerships between civil society and the government, ensuring that responsive and accountable governance provide a lawful and effective means for citizens to protect their rights, voice their concerns, hold their representatives to account, and satisfy their basic needs. This mechanism will enable a credible, sustainable civil society to interact with the government in support of improved policymaking and service delivery, and facilitate the citizen feedback that is necessary for a stable democratic society. The program will work in three primary areas:.Facilitate the transparent, efficient funding of civil society organizations by providing technical assistance to government bodies in their implementation of the law on social procurement;Provide targeted sub-grants in support of citizen engagement, civil society input into public policy, and national networks for policy advocacy; andIncrease access to justice for the most vulnerable populations, including by assisting the Ministry of Justice to improve the management of previously opened free legal clinics..This activity supports ICS objective 3.2, "Support improved policy formation, governance, and service delivery to better connect the government to its people," and ICS objective 3.3, "Strengthen the financial and managerial self-sufficiency and technical capacity of key civil society organizations (CSOs) and government institutions to advocate more effectively for greater respect of and attention to human rights for all citizens, focusing on marginalized, at-risk minorities."...

description.narrative: (Kyrgyz Republic): USAID's work will reduce the Kyrgyz Republic's burden of tuberculosis (TB) and will support universal and equitable access to quality TB services through a strengthened health system by: 1) improving access to TB services for those at high risk; 2) strengthening the national human and institutional capacity to quality TB treatment services; 3) improving national TB data quality and use. The project will continue to build on progress made to date by expanding on: a) improving equitable access to comprehensive TB diagnostic and treatment services; b) developing a patient-centered system for treating TB and multi-drug-resistant TB (MDR-TB); c) strengthening human and institutional capacity of the Kyrgyz health system to manage TB and MDR-TB services; d) supporting laboratories to improve the timeliness and quality of TB and MDR-TB diagnosis; and e) training TB service providers to use an electronic TB management information system for evidence-based decision making.

title.narrative: Enhancing Employability and Civic Engagement of Youth in the Kyrgyz Republic

description.narrative: (Kyrgyz Republic): USAID's youth activity will continue to support young people, ages 14-28, who seek to participate more actively in the civic and economic spheres of society and contribute to the development of their communities. In the long term, USAID seeks to reinforce the stability of Kyrgyzstan's democracy by promoting more active and positive youth participation in civic and social life. Outcomes will include increased leadership opportunities for youth in public life, and a stronger sense of civic responsibility among targeted youth. Funds will also include support for youth-led community development initiatives and advocacy for improved national policies related to youth. This activity supports ICS objective 1.1: Engage with the security services, government officials, educators, youth, religious leaders, and civil society to advocate for strengthened institutional capacity and greater cooperation, in order to combat and prevent the rise of violent extremism through a more inclusive and just society.

Objectives for Kyrgyz Republic: The project works to increase civic participation of youth and prepare them for the labor market by creating various opportunities. Through the project hundreds of young people will be able to enhance their leadership and life skills as well as strengthen their professional and entrepreneurial skills. The project will also facilitate youth participation in development of their communities and generate a robust research base to support evidence-driven youth policy development.

description.narrative: In April 2010, the Government of Kyrgyzstan and its president were brought down amid protests over corruption, abuse of power, and increasing utility prices. Within days a new Government assumed power, followed in June 2010 by a new constitution and parliamentary centric system. The elections to the new Parliamentthe Jogorku Kenesh, or Supreme Councilwere held on October 10, 2010. Challenges abound for the new parliamentarians; they face deep cynicism about state structures because both of Kyrgyzstans post-Soviet Presidents fell into corruption and authoritarianism and were deposed after widespread protests. Tensions continue to simmer in the countrys south between ethnic Uzbeks and Kyrgyz. If Kyrgyzstan is able to meet these challenges, its new parliamentary system could sustain a reasonable balance of power that curbs corruption and incentivizes constructive politics. Its transition to a more democratic and effective form of governance could inspire other countries in the region. Failure of the new Parliament, though, could destabilize other states in Central Asia, particularly Uzbekistan. To effect reform and stability, the Parliament must work toward three intertwined objectives: being a more constructive actor in the Kyrgyz state system, a responsive and representative body, and a well-managed institution. DAI supported the Parliament (Jogorku Kenesh) in that effort.

description.narrative: (Kyrgyz Republic): In partnership with the private sector, the activity seeks to increase the productivity, sales and incomes of farmers, agribusinesses and agriculture-related micro, small, and medium size enterprises (MSMEs). The activity expands market opportunities, links farmers to buyers, establishes commercially sustainable buyer-seller relationships, introduces best management practices and new technologies, promotes innovation and, mobilizes local and international private investments and expertise. Targeting fruits, vegetables crops, and dairy products, farmers benefit from inputs and services as well as training in new technologies and on-farm management practices. The activity also promotes exports and trade with local and international firms to establish and expand markets. A 12 month extension of the existing contract is envisioned to ensure the sustainability of commercial outcomes with partner MSMEs and to address programmatic gaps before a new agriculture activity is procured in FY 2019.

Objectives for Kyrgyzstan: The project works to increase smallholder farmers incomes by improving productivity, expanding markets and creating private sector-led partnerships to increase competitiveness of selected agricultural value chains. The project creates jobs in the agricultural sector especially for women and youth while improving the availability of nutritious foods.

description.narrative: (Kyrgyz Republic): .Through its support to 50 key municipalities, USAID's Community and Municipal Governance Initiative will continue to improve local governance and promote a culture of civic engagement that drives demand for democratic rule and reinforces stability at the community level. This activity will support the development of a sound national-level decentralization policy, and improve the ability of local government bodies at the regional, municipal, and village levels to deliver more efficient and inclusive services. Activities will support capacity building and professionalization of local government officials in core management skills, promote peer-learning and collaboration with civil society and private sector actors, improve access to key government services in all sectors, strengthen local procurement, increase citizen input into local-level decision-making, and advocate for administrative and budget devolution to better meet the needs of local government. Expected results include an increased capacity of local government actors to mobilize local resources, improved local-level responsiveness to community needs, more effective representation of these needs to national-level bodies, and increased satisfaction of citizens in their local governments. This activity supports ICS objective 3.2: Support improved policy formation, governance, and service delivery to better connect the government to its people..

Objectives for Kyrgyz Republic: Program Objectives: Effective service delivery. The project assists partner municipalities in improving delivery of key services such as solid waste management, water supply, lighting or road reconstruction by helping to plan, budget, manage, and oversee in accordance with state regulations and international best practice. Improved citizens perception. The project seeks to engage all citizen groups including women, youth and minorities to monitor the service delivery. Citizens can provide feedback on services while developing more realistic expectations of what municipalities can deliver. Strengthened sustainability. The project cooperates and improves capacity of the Union of Local Self-Governments (LSGs) and local non-government organizations (NGOs) in Jalal-Abad, Issyk-Kul, Naryn, and Osh regions to extend the projects successes through networking and replication among partner LSGs. In the future, the Union of LSGs and local NGOs are planned to provide consulting services to LSGs.

description.narrative: (Kyrgyz Republic): USAID invests in the economic and political future of the Kyrgyz Republic by supporting education for its youngest citizens, improving early grade reading outcomes in grades one through four in targeted schools throughout the country. This activity will: 1) improving reading instruction through in-service and pre-service training to teachers and faculty; 2) increasing access to and availability of quality reading materials that will support the development of reading; and 3) enhancing Kyrgyz government support to improve reading, including promotion of out-of-school reading. The Time to Read! activity will target 40 percent of primary students at 900 schools, building on prior USAID investments that reached the other 60 percent of schools throughout the country. The activity will also support pedagogical institutions with improved reading pre-service training to improve reading skills among students in primary grades one through four. By improving the quality of reading instruction at all administrative levels of the education system, this activity supports ICS objective 3.2, "Support improved policy formation, governance, and service delivery to better connect the government to its people.".

Objectives for Kyrgyz Republic: The Time to Read Program helps to improve the foundational reading skills of students in grades 1 4. The program works with the Ministry of Education and Science of the Kyrgyz Republic to increase education outcomes in 900 Kyrgyz and Russian language schools. To enrich students learning experiences, USAID is also focusing on ensuring that primary grade students use a variety of age- and context-appropriate quality learning materials. This work includes strengthening the capacity of local authors, illustrators, and publishing houses to create new stories, and the introduction of a groundbreaking tool used to evaluate books and categorize them according to the level of difficulty. Finally, the program engages parents and communities to support students reading competencies.

title.narrative: Voter Education and Monitoring of Parliamentary Elections 2015

description.narrative: This program will support one or a network of local civil society organizations to conduct nationwide election monitoring and observation - as well as voter education -surrounding the fall 2015 Parliamentary elections. This programwill include capacity building as necessary on electoral monitoring techniques, such as parallel vote tabulation or statistically-based observation; the development of education materials (including pamphlets, PSAs, and social media) to ensure citizen knowledge of the processes and their rights surrounding voting; and quality reporting in advance of election day itself.

title.narrative: Facilitating Parliament, Voter Education and Elections Observation

description.narrative: (Kyrgyz Republic): .This activity will enable citizens of the Kyrgyz Republic to participate actively in fair and transparent electoral processes, and hold their elected officials accountable to campaign promises. The activity will achieve three main results:.Independent election observation conducted in accordance with international standards;Voters better understand voting procedures and their roles and responsibilities as citizens in the political process; andCivil society oversight and public access to information increases the ability of elected political actors to fulfill their responsibilities to citizens.The activity will build on its prior-year support for presidential elections by conducting voter education and polling. Information campaigns will help voters to understand the results of the activity's election monitoring work, and polling will evaluate the success of voter education campaigns both pre and post-elections. This activity supports ICS objective 3.1, "Support a more inclusive and accountable democracy."..

Objectives for Kyrgyzstan: The project is aimed at advancing democracy in the Kyrgyzstan through free, fair and transparent 2016 local council and 2017 presidential elections; and providing comprehensive monitoring of the Kyrgyz Parliament.

description.narrative: (Kyrgyz Republic): The objective of the Building the Future activity is to provide access to high-quality undergraduate education to students from the Central Asia region, as well as to improve the long-term capacity of the American University of Central Asia to deliver high quality education to its students and develop programs of academic excellence. The three intervention areas of the program are: 1) providing 84 scholarships for eligible applicants; 2) improving the research capacity of faculty and students of the university through trainings on academic writing and publishing and funding research grants (8 to 10 per year); and 3) achieving and maintaining accreditation for the Business Administration Program Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business and the Association of MBAs by supporting the application process and applicable fees.

description.narrative: (Kyrgyz Republic): The goal of this program is to help the Kyrgyz Republic further consolidate its democracy through strengthening the responsiveness and sustainability of political institutions - specifically political parties, elected parliamentary representatives, and election administration bodies. FY 2014 funds will be used to support the country's preparation for fall 2015 Parliamentary elections through training for political parties, civic education on election-related rights and obligations, support to the Central Election Commission and other electoral management bodies, and improved mechanisms for communication between elected officials and citizens.

Objectives for Kyrgyzstan: The Kyrgyzstan Political Processes Program is a four-year program funded by the United States Agency for International Development (USAID) and the United Kingdom Department for International Development (DFID). This program is implemented by all three members of the Consortium for Elections and Political Process Strengthening (CEPPS) and works to consolidate the Kyrgyzstans democratic path by supporting the development of a multi-party political system with strong, national parties, developing the next generation of leaders by equipping youth and women with the skills to actively engage in the political process and improving local government transparency and responsiveness.

description.narrative: Strengthen the legal, regulatory, institutional, and information environment which protects and enables the growth in associational life and the development of independent and sustainable civil society organizations (CSOs). Build the capacity of civil society organizations to act as agents for reform and support their participation in democratic decision-making through articulating and representing their members interests, engaging in service delivery, and advocating for issues which become part of the public agenda and are reflected in public policies. Encourage the strengthening of a civic culture which supports democratic institutions and processes, active participation in political and civic life, and the civic virtues of tolerance, pluralism, compromise, trust, and respect for individual rights, including gender equality.

description.narrative: Improve the capacity of businesses to integrate into domestic and international markets through increases in productivity and improvements in corporate governance and the development and application of modern technology and marketing practices. Enhance the capacity of businesses and business associations in terms of their corporate governance capabilities and their application of best practices and technologies to achieve increased production and marketing of products and services. It includes adoption of efficient production processes, improved labor productivity, environmentally-sound management of natural resources and the development of accounting and management systems that can help the company and industry group implement business, labor, product and process standards that enhance business competitiveness. Business capacity development programs may include activities that help men- and women-owned firms and associations respond to these international markets and create regional alliances.

description.narrative: (Kyrgyz Republic): USAID's Political Processes Program Follow-on will continue to advance the U.S. government's objective of an inclusive and accountable democracy by facilitating greater popular participation in political processes across all levels of government and by enabling increased mutual accountability between citizens and government. The activity works by helping political parties and parliamentary factions to better identify and respond to citizen concerns, and to communicate their work through a variety of outreach platforms and mechanisms. Funds will also support: strengthening political parties; helping the central election commission to improve the organization of elections; supporting organizational development of domestic election monitoring organizations, including intensive capacity building and technical support in conducting short- and long-term election observation; and supporting leadership opportunities and civic education to increase inclusion of historically underserved and disenfranchised groups, including youth and women and people with disabilities. This activity supports ICS objective 3.1: Support a more inclusive and accountable democracy.

title.narrative: Cultivating Media Independence (CMI) Initiative Activity in the Kyrgyz Republic, Media-K

description.narrative: (Kyrgyz Republic): USAID's Media-K initiative will continue to support the development of a more professional, financially viable, and independent media sector. This activity will result in media outlets which better serve the public interest by providing access to diverse and balanced information and analyses about the issues that are of most concern to citizens, while providing a counterweight to state-funded media. This activity will include the provision of training, technical expertise, and mentoring to Kyrgyzstani journalists, media outlets, and production companies to help them build their skills and increase the production of high-quality domestic content. The activity will stimulate the production of domestic content that responds to audience demand, strengthen the ability of targeted media outlets to use audience research to attract more advertising, and bring together disparate stakeholders to advocate for a healthy enabling environment for media businesses. This activity supports ICS objective 3.1: Support a more inclusive and accountable democracy.

Objectives for Kyrgyz Republic: Media-K aims to strengthen the professionalism and independence of media in the Kyrgyz Republic in order to ensure that citizens of the Kyrgyz Republic have greater access to diverse and balanced information, are less vulnerable to media bias, and are empowered to make better-informed civic decisions that reflect their communities priorities to best serve the public interest.

description.narrative: Improve the capacity of businesses to integrate into domestic and international markets through increases in productivity and improvements in corporate governance and the development and application of modern technology and marketing practices. Enhance the capacity of businesses and business associations in terms of their corporate governance capabilities and their application of best practices and technologies to achieve increased production and marketing of products and services. It includes adoption of efficient production processes, improved labor productivity, environmentally-sound management of natural resources and the development of accounting and management systems that can help the company and industry group implement business, labor, product and process standards that enhance business competitiveness. Business capacity development programs may include activities that help men- and women-owned firms and associations respond to these international markets and create regional alliances.

description.narrative: (Kyrgyz Republic): The activity seeks to increase the competitiveness, productivity, sales and incomes of micro, small, and medium size enterprises (MSMEs) in sectors that have high growth and employment potential (apparel, tourism, and construction materials). In partnership with the private sector, the activity introduces best management practices and new technologies, promotes innovation and, mobilizes local and international private investments and expertise. It also partners with buyers, market intermediaries, brokerage and logistics services, certification bodies and other private sector stakeholders in support of commercially sustainable relationships between assisted enterprises and local and international buyers. The activity also advances reforms to improve the business enabling environment. A 12 month extension of the existing contract is envisioned to ensure the sustainability of commercial relationships between assisted apparel MSMEs and European and regional buyers.

Millennium Challenge Corporation

description.narrative: The purpose of the three-year USAID Local Development Program (LDP) was to stimulate rapid, diversified, and sustained economic growth by supporting local economic development in Kyrgyzstan. Through the program, Chemonics trained government staff, facilitated trade, investments and access to finance, and supported priority sectors such as agriculture and textile to become engines of growth within a relatively short period.

Objectives for Kyrgyzstan: The USAID Local Development Program (LDP) was a three and a half-year project designed to support local economic development in the Kyrgyzstan implemented. LDP was designed to create sustainable economic development in the private and public sectors through local, regional and national initiatives. LDPs technical work included two broad components: 1. Reform Agenda: including activities designed to scale up local level pilot activities in the areas of access to finance, land reform, and tax administration. 2. Private Sector Competiveness: focusing on partnerships with growth, particularly in the agricultural and textile sectors.

description.narrative: Develop and conduct needs assessments, baseline studies, targeted evaluations, special studies or other information-gathering efforts specifically for the design, monitoring and evaluation of USG-funded programs. This sub-element may also include developing and disseminating best practices and lessons learned, testing demonstration and/or pilot models, or the preparation of strategic plans and other short-term programming tasks. Note: All such activities that are carried out by partners as an integral part of their monitoring and evaluation efforts for programs funded under other sub-elements should be included within those sub-elements.

title.narrative: Good Governance and Public Administration Strengthening (GGPAS) Project

description.narrative: The Good Governance and Public Administration Strengthening (GGPAS) program is a flexible, three-year initiative to help strengthen key public and private institutions critical to long-term stability and democratic growth. GGPAS provides targeted assistance for governance reform in order to: Improve management processes in key institutions to formulate better policies and deliver services more effectively and efficiently; improve inclusiveness in policy-making and equitable service delivery for all citizens across the provinces. GGPAS employs a unique management model to help USAID target assistance to reform-oriented institutions in the Kyrgyz Republic. It works across sectors as opportunities emerge, strengthening existing partnerships, and establishing new relationships with key institutions. Specific activities have been identified based on the demonstrated priorities of the government of Kyrgyz Republic and the comparative advantages of USAID.

Objectives for Kyrgyzstan: The Good Governance and Public Administration Strengthening (GGPAS) program is a flexible, three-year initiative to help strengthen key public and private institutions critical to long-term stability and democratic growth. GGPAS provides targeted assistance for governance reform in order to: Strengthen the abilities of public sector institutions to deliver key services more effectively and efficiently; and Help a range of public, private, and civil society partners expand access to and improve the quality of citizen services. Employing a unique management model, GGPAS works across sectors as opportunities emerge, strengthening existing partnerships, and establishing new relationships with key institutions. Initiatives reflect the priorities of the government of the Kyrgyzstan and the comparative advantages of USAID.

This element should be done, when possible, as part of an integrated, coordinated and/or multi-sectoral approach.
